channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Chip firm ASML shares plunge 15% after warning of weaker China sales in early release
item.description: ASML published its third-quarter earnings Tuesday, a day earlier than expected.

item.title: U.S. crude prices fall 5% as Israel is not expected to strike Iran's oil industry
item.description: The International Energy Agency said Tuesday that its members are prepared to take action if there is a supply disruption in the Middle East.

item.title: Eli Lilly to trial use of weight loss drugs to combat unemployment in UK
item.description: U.S. pharmaceutical giant Eli Lilly is exploring whether obesity drugs could be used to curb joblessness after signing a major investment deal with the U.K.

item.title: Goldman Sachs beats on profit and revenue as stock trading and investment banking boost results
item.description: Wall Street trading and investment banking has helped the big banks this quarter, and Goldman Sachs results showed why they are a leader in those areas.

item.title: From swimming cars to rectangular steering wheels, here's what's going on at the Paris auto show
item.description: Auto giants have descended on the Paris Motor Show to showcase their latest concepts and production models.

item.title: This influencer was scammed out of thousands in crypto — and has a tip to help you avoid fraud
item.description: A British fitness and wellness influencer who was duped into handing over $7,450 worth of crypto and has a tip on how to avoid falling into the same trap.

item.title: Apple announces new iPad mini, available to order now and in stores on Oct. 23
item.description: Apple announced a new iPad mini on Tuesday, offering the first update to its smallest tablet since 2021. It starts at $499 and launches in stores on Oct. 23.

item.title: Protesters in Spain told tourists to 'go home.' Instead more arrived.
item.description: Tourist arrivals to Spain increased following anti-tourism protests earlier this year. But organizers against mass tourism say the fight is far from over.

item.title: Ericsson shares jump 10% on third-quarter beat, growth in North America sales
item.description: Shares of Swedish telecom firm Ericsson jumped amid third-quarter core earnings that surpassed analyst expectations and growth North American demand.

item.title: Overtourism: It's not the tourists — it's local 'lack of management,' says sustainability expert
item.description: Overtourism can be alleviated by better awareness and management at the local level, said Randy Durband, CEO of the Global Sustainable Tourism Council.

item.title: Dutch government to reduce its stake in ABN Amro by a quarter
item.description: The Dutch government said Tuesday it will reduce its stake in ABN Amro to around 30% through a trading plan.

item.title: Walgreens says it will close 1,200 stores by 2027, as earnings top estimates
item.description: The drugstore chain Walgreens said it plans to close roughly 1,200 stores over the next three years, which includes 500 closures in fiscal 2025 alone.

item.title: Bank of America tops estimates on better-than-expected trading revenue
item.description: Bank of America benefited from its Wall Street trading and banking divisions in the third quarter, just as rival JPMorgan Chase did.

item.title: UK trade deals with India and Gulf nations are 'the priority,’ business minister says
item.description: The U.K. said Monday that securing deals with India and Gulf nations remains "the priority" for Labour's free trade agenda, with talks between Britain and the Gulf Corporation Council expected to resume as soon as next week.

item.title: Tokyo Metro's IPO could propel the Japanese market as investors seek China alternatives
item.description: "We think they're offering very, very good value," Mio Kato, founder of LightStream Research, told CNBC.

item.title: Asian semiconductor stocks rise after shares of AI chip darling Nvidia hit a record high
item.description: Nvidia's gains in share price lifted its market value to top $3.4 trillion, unseating Microsoft as the second most valuable company on Wall Street.

item.title: Xpeng president says Chinese EV firm remains committed to Europe despite pressure from tariffs
item.description: Xpeng, the Chinese electric vehicle maker, says it remains committed to Europe for the long term despite pressure it faces from the European Union's tariffs.

item.title: European Central Bank set for third interest rate cut of the year in meeting this week
item.description: Markets are eyeing two more rate cuts from the euro area's central bank this year amid a weak growth outlook and lower inflation.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: The economy and inflation might stay strong
item.description: After the strong slate of data on employment, income growth and inflation, there’s chatter that the U.S. economy might be headed for a "no landing" scenario.

item.title: Fed Governor Waller sees need for 'more caution' ahead when lowering interest rates
item.description: Waller on Monday signaled that future interest rate cuts will be less aggressive than the big move in September.

item.title: China's exports and imports grew far less than expected in September
item.description: China was expected Monday to report a slowdown in export growth in September versus August.

item.title: China's Ministry of Finance is taking aim at local debt problems before tackling broader economic challenges
item.description: In his opening remarks on Saturday, Minister of Finance Lan Fo'an laid out four measures, starting with increasing support for local governments in resolving debt risks.

item.title: Google signs deal with nuclear company as data center power demand surges
item.description: Google is the latest tech company to turn to nuclear energy as power demand from data centers surges.

item.title: ServiceNow, Coreweave and others to invest $8.2 billion in UK data centers to fuel AI growth
item.description: American enterprise software giant ServiceNow and cloud computing startup CoreWeave plan to invest billions of dollars in their U.K. operations.

item.title: Elon Musk is on track to become a trillionaire by 2027. Here's why the rich keep getting richer
item.description: Wealthier individuals typically have larger portions of their assets in the stock market, while middle-income households hold more wealth in real estate.

item.title: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer vows to slash regulatory red tape in bid to boost investment
item.description: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Monday vowed to slash regulatory red tape to boost anaemic investment in the country.

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway hikes its SiriusXM stake to 32% after Liberty deal
item.description: Berkshire hiked its bet after Liberty Media completed its deal in early September to combine its tracking stocks with the rest of the entertainment company.

item.title: Nobel economics prize for 2024 awarded to Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson and James Robinson
item.description: The winner of the award, officially the "Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel," receives $1 million.

item.title: Boeing factory strike crosses 1-month mark as pressure mounts on new CEO
item.description: Boeing's CEO Ortberg will answer to investors in his first Oct. 23 earnings presentation as the aerospace giant faces swirling crises.

item.title: SpaceX’s Starship rocket completes fifth test flight, lands booster in dramatic catch
item.description: SpaceX launched its fifth test flight of its Starship rocket on Sunday, taking a major step forward in the vehicle's development.
